sen.j: 宇治川の戦い（うじがわのたたかい）は、平安時代末期の寿永3年（1184年）1月に源義仲と鎌倉の源頼朝から派遣された源範頼、源義経とで戦われた合戦。
sen.e: The Battle of Uji-gawa River was a battle in January 1184, at the end of Heian period, between MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, and MINAMOTO no Noriyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune who were dispatched by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in Kamakura.

sen.e: In July 1183, MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka who raised an army in Shinano Province to overturn the Taira family, led several tens of thousands of knights into Kyoto.

sen.j: 義仲軍は京で乱暴狼藉を働き、やがて皇位継承を巡って後白河天皇とも対立した。
sen.e: Yoshinaka's troops brought violence and riots to Kyoto, and with time, was in conflict with Emperor Goshirakawa over succession to the imperial throne.

sen.e: In September, Yoshinaka's troops was severely defeated by the troops of Taira family in the Battle of Mizushima in Bizen Province, and Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa forsook him.

sen.e: In October, Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa sends an imperial letter to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo authorizing control over Tokaido and Tosando, and approaches Yoritomo (imperial letter of October, Juei 2).

sen.e: In November, Yoshinaka makes a revival by attacking the Hoju-ji Temple Palace, the residence of the retired Emperor, and confines the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa to gain power (the Battle of Hoju-ji Temple).

sen.e: In January 1184, Yoshinaka was appointed Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") (or Seito Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians")).

sen.e: On January 20th, Yoritomo ordered Noriyori and Yoshitsune, whom he had moved to Omi, to track down and kill Yoshinaka.

sen.e: Yoshinaka's troops, which numbered several tens of thousands of knights when they went into Kyoto, had decreased dramatically down to about one thousand knights, because of a stream of dropouts due to the defeat in the Battle of Mizushima and deteriorating situation.

sen.j: 義仲は義仲四天王の今井兼平に500余騎を与えて瀬田 (滋賀県)を、根井行親、楯親忠には300余騎で宇治市を守らせ、義仲自身は100余騎で院御所を守護した。
